page.title: 01EXMOUTH COASTAL AREA
page.content: The area is an interesting mixture of sea coast, estuary head, mixed farmland, residential and town centre. The farmland is mainly grassland and crops (barley and wheat). At the extreme eastern end of the block is a massive chalet/caravan holiday park, although it does not intrude on the pleasant rolling countryside due to certain planning restrictions. Much of the income of the area is derived from tourism. There are a great many hotels and guest houses offering family accomadation, although little in the way of entertainment apart from pubs, amusement arcades, the Pavillion which has a stage and seats about 800 people and the Blackmore Theatre. There is no cinema. The area offers a variety of sports; bowling, tennis cricket, windsurfing and sailing.
